We tried the link you gave below, but it appears that GM took the
commercials off their site, but we found another link where someone put a
bunch together. The first one didn't work for us, but others did. FUNNY!!

some very funny ones too, you just have to click around and find them.

We're laughing!
Thanks!
Jacki

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Mothers-in-law
messages.msgSnippet: I know it can be difficult to deal with family members.  I will say for me that when it comes to my children I am extremely protective, as is my husband.  His
messages.messageBody:
I know it can be difficult to deal with family members. I will say for me that when it comes to my children I am extremely protective, as is my husband. His mother is not allowed to be alone with the children. She is mean, spiteful, selfish, and many other things. The last time we saw her was November. We keep it that way with lots of space in between. My daughter feels bad for her because she's so mean. It's a sad thing when a seven yr old has pity on their grandparent.

Maisha
http://www.geocities.com/maitai373/EarthSpirit.html<http://www.geocities.com/maitai373/EarthSpirit.html>
http://khalfanifamilyadventures.blogspot.com/<http://khalfanifamilyadventures.blogspot.com/>
"Don't be afraid of showing affection. Be warm and tender, thoughtful and affectionate. Mankind is more helped by sympathy than by service. Love is more than money, and a kind word will give more pleasure than a present."
~ Jean Baptiste Lacordaire

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Mothers-in-law
messages.msgSnippet: The mother-in-law would get ONE warning. Yep, same here. Screw the school fees, the emotional ABUSE isn t worth it. Cripes. Ren learninginfreedom.com
messages.messageBody:
"The mother-in-law would get ONE warning."

Yep, same here. Screw the school fees, the emotional ABUSE isn't worth
it. Cripes.

Ren
learninginfreedom.com

messages.subject: Mothers-in-law
messages.msgSnippet: ... so no chance of us paying them!
messages.messageBody:
>>>>>She's paying H's school fees and its something H wants to do. we're on welfare
so no chance of us paying them!
<<<<

So you're saying that, if you put your foot down, she would refuse to pay for her
granddaughter to receive this MOST important step to becoming a person?

I doubt it. She might threaten, but I bet she'd keep doing it---especially of Heather is doing
well. At least she gets to brag about *one* grand-child.

Either way, I wouldn't put up with that for ONE second.

~Kelly

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Mothers-in-law
messages.msgSnippet: kbcdlovejo@aol.com wrote: The mother-in-law would get ONE warning. Then she would never be allowed to darken my doorstep again. She would never be allowed to
messages.messageBody:
kbcdlovejo@... wrote:

The mother-in-law would get ONE warning.

Then she would never be allowed to darken my doorstep again.

She would never be allowed to speak to my children on neutral ground
without *close* supervision.

I'm always amazed at what other people will put up with. And for years
and years and years.

One warning.


~Kelly



She's paying H's school fees and its something H wants to do. we're on welfare so no chance of us paying them!

S

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Mothers-in-law
messages.msgSnippet: I completely agree! And I have been in the unfortunate position of following through with my own mother. She refused to respect our choices. We were not
messages.messageBody:
I completely agree! And I have been in the unfortunate position of following
through with my own mother. She refused to respect our choices. We were not
looking for approval, but demanded and expected respect. The same respect we
were willing to give to her choices. It was actually her partner that was
causing all the ruckus (I have never met a more condescending, rude,
disrespectful person in my life), but she had to make choices. We had about
2 years of not seeing her and very limited contact via phone. It was not
easy, but it was necessary and good. We actually have a very good
relationship with her now. She moved out on her own. She now respects our
choices and even agrees with some of what we do...what she doesn't agree
with she keeps to herself when the kids are around. We have a pretty good
time now when we get together.

I cannot imagine allowing anyone to say such horrible things to me or my
children. No one has that right, absolutely no one.

~April
Mom to Kate-19, Lisa-17, Karl-14, & Ben-10.
*REACH Homeschool Grp, an inclusive group in Oakland County
http://www.reachhomeschool.com
* Michigan Unschoolers
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/michigan_unschoolers/
*Check out Chuck's art www.artkunst23.com
"All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given to us."
Gandalf the Grey

On 4/21/06, kbcdlovejo@... <kbcdlovejo@...> wrote:
>
>
>
> Original message:
>
> "Eldest is absorbing this
> and her values have changed but she's also unhappy because she feels
> she should
> get 100% in every test and be the cleverest, thinnest, etc etc. I'm
> worried sick
> and constantly tell her that I love her for herself, that I'm not
> fussed about
> school. Then MIL visits and undoes all I say by telling H that only
> stupid
> people stay at home and look after kids (that'll be me....), only
> stupid people
> have disabled kids etc. Its reaLLYmessing up our family and making H
> unhappy. I
> don't know what to say to her to counter MIL and help her feel that who
> is she
> is whats important, not some grade no-one will recall in 5 years time."
>
> -=-=-=-=-=-
>
> The mother-in-law would get ONE warning.
>
> Then she would never be allowed to darken my doorstep again.
>
> She would never be allowed to speak to my children on neutral ground
> without *close* supervision.
>
> I'm always amazed at what other people will put up with. And for years
> and years and years.
>
> One warning.
>
>
> ~Kelly
>
> Kelly Lovejoy
> Conference Coordinator
> Live and Learn Unschooling Conference
> http://liveandlearnconference.org
>
>
>

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Mothers-in-law
messages.msgSnippet: Original message: Eldest is absorbing this and her values have changed but she s also unhappy because she feels she should get 100% in every test and be the
messages.messageBody:
Original message:

"Eldest is absorbing this
and her values have changed but she's also unhappy because she feels
she should
get 100% in every test and be the cleverest, thinnest, etc etc. I'm
worried sick
and constantly tell her that I love her for herself, that I'm not
fussed about
school. Then MIL visits and undoes all I say by telling H that only
stupid
people stay at home and look after kids (that'll be me....), only
stupid people
have disabled kids etc. Its reaLLYmessing up our family and making H
unhappy. I
don't know what to say to her to counter MIL and help her feel that who
is she
is whats important, not some grade no-one will recall in 5 years time."

-=-=-=-=-=-

The mother-in-law would get ONE warning.

Then she would never be allowed to darken my doorstep again.

She would never be allowed to speak to my children on neutral ground
without *close* supervision.

I'm always amazed at what other people will put up with. And for years
and years and years.

One warning.


~Kelly

Kelly Lovejoy
Conference Coordinator
Live and Learn Unschooling Conference
http://liveandlearnconference.org
